title: Export Address Book in csv for mat to import into Outlook
content: I’m running Thunderbird 128.6.0esr (64-bit). I’m trying to export my address book in csv format. I tried to follow these instructions: Start Thunderbird In Address Books Select address book (not 'All Address Books' as it is a virtual search and not a true address book) Tools > Export Choose where to save Save as either: Comma Separated *csv files OR LDIF Click on 'SAve' However, I not finding the option to save as *.csv file. I get abook.sqlite file, but I can’t open file. What app do I use to open file so I can get a *csv file to I can export to use in Outlook. Thanks, John
creator: jmrjnr1312

title: Untick Enable adaptive junk mail controls for this account NOT working
content:
I found several unread emails in my Spam folder (without that folder indicating anything was in it), yet "Enable adaptive junk mail controls for this account" is NOT set. How do I ensure that NO email gets put in the Spam folder automatically?

Also, what is the difference between what you call Junk vs Spam? I see no Junk folder.

title: TB beta 135.0b2 ...Setting Default provider for email in System Integration
content:
Open Settings

General/system Integration

click on check now (to see if Thunderbird beta is trh default mail client on startup)

No boxes are ticked (mail, newsgroups,feeds,calendar)

I tick the Email box and then click 'Set as default'

This closes thar box I then click on 'Check Now'....the ticked Email has unticked itself.

Note: I go to menu and access 'Preferred Applications' .....Thunderbird does not appear as a choice for 'Mail' It also does not appear in the Menu. I do not know how to make that happen

Linux Mint 22 & Linux Mint 22.1

Brian
creator: condobloke1
